active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a real-world cyber incident like a ransomware attack, debate the trade-offs between rapid recovery (prioritizing RTO) versus thorough validation to prevent re-infection (prioritizing resilience). Use NIST SP 800-184 to support arguments and address common misconceptions about speed versus security.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Incident Response. Topic: 005_Recovery Coordination (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > 002_Incident Response Team Organization > 003_Roles and Responsibilities > Operational Responsibilities > 005_Recovery Coordination). Use this comprehensive content: Core Concepts: Recovery coordination is the post-incident phase restoring systems/services/data, minimizing impact, ensuring continuity, preventing recurrence. Key aspects: restoration, resilience, BC, DR. Metrics: RTO (time to recover), RPO (data loss tolerance). Frameworks: NIST CSF 2.0 (recovery in risk mgmt), NIST SP 800-61 Rev. 3 (IR recommendations), SP 800-184 (event recovery), Rev. 2 (incident handling). Best Practices: Integrate with risk mgmt; communication protocols; post-recovery review/lessons learned. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [insert array from above] - Scaffolding Layers: [insert scaffolding from above] - Active Learning: Ensure flashcards support discussion/activities (e.g., trade-offs, scenarios). Generate 25-30 flashcards following the exact schema: {type: 'Q&A' or 'MCQ', question: '...', [for Q&A: answer], [for MCQ: correct_answer, distractors: ['d1','d2','d3']], explanation: '...', blooms_level: 'REMEMBER|etc', references: 'NIST SP 800-61 etc', scaffolding_layer: '1|2|3|4'}. Distractors: Follow protocol - plausible, educational. Balance: Cover all objectives/layers. Voter consensus: 82.9% approval, emphasize completeness (risk mgmt, reviews), pedagogy (Bloom's progression). Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcard objects.
